item.title: Recombination and the evolution of base composition in prokaryotic genomes
item.description: What’s all the fuss about base composition ? Every genome is made of only four nucleotides : Adenine, Thymine, Guanine and Cytosine. By convention, biologists describe base composition of genomes in term of GC content, or GC%. $$ GC\% = \frac{GC}{AT + GC} $$ Base composition is a fundamental genome trait. It typically varies many fold over the genome, and between genome. Since fifty years, microbial GC-content diversity has been described1.
